author: Anonymous Atom
title: number of variables when defining function
question:
when defining new function , how do we determine number of variables for the function?
for example (lecture material)
--------------------------------------------------------------------
(@htdd Egg)
(define-struct egg (x y r))
;; Egg is (make-egg Number Number Number)
;; interp. the x, y position of an egg in screen coordinates (pixels),
;;         and rotation angle in degrees
(define E1 (make-egg 100 50 23))
(define E2 (make-egg 20 30 50))
(@dd-template-rules compound) ;3 fields

(define (fn-for-egg e)
  (... (egg-x e)    ;Number
       (egg-y e)    ;Number
       (egg-r e)))  ;Number
-------------------------------------------------
(@template Egg)
(define (place-egg e img)
  (place-image (rotate  (egg-r e) YOSHI-EGG)
               (egg-x e)
               (egg-y e)
               img))
  template is from Egg but where is only 1 variable in the template
do we change the number of it under the circumstance? based on what we need for the function?
